abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of this framework
            is to present a process for dealing with land acquisition
            issues arising from the implementation of micro-projects
            under the Village Investment Project (VIP) for Kyrgyz
            Republic that is fully integrated with the existing social
            mobilization. Some of the negative impacts and their
            mitigation measures are: 1) land acquisition and the
            displacement of formal or informal users from ayil okmotu
            land should be avoided at all possible by finding
            alternative sites; 2) communities proposing micro-projects
            working in partnership with ayil okmotu should take the lead
            in finding solutions to land acquisition problems; 3) the
            potentially adversely affected persons, who may lose land,
            or access to land, as a result of the implementation of a
            micro-project, should be informed that this is the case at
            the earliest possible stage in the social mobilization
            process; 4) potentially adversely affected persons should be
            consulted by the community throughout the process on the
            assets to be acquired, the alternative mechanisms for
            providing compensation/assistance, recourse to grievance
            procedures etc; and 5) any voluntary donation of private or
            public land for the purposes of realizing a micro-project
            should have clear title.
